name: Code42 v2
description: Code42 provides simple, fast detection and response to everyday data loss from insider threats by focusing on customer data on endpoints and the cloud

initial_poll_start_date.description: The start date to use in the initial poll in yyyy-MM-dd HH:MM:SS format (defaults to 30 days back)

initial_poll_end_date.description: The end date to use in the initial poll in yyyy-MM-dd HH:MM:SS format (defaults to the current time)

severity_to_poll_for.description: A comma-separated list of alert severities to poll for, such as HIGH, LOW, MODERATE or CRITICAL (defaults to getting all alerts)

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality

container_id.description: Alert IDs to limit the ingestion to (limited to 100)

container_count.description: Maximum number of alerts to create (only used in Poll Now)

artifact_count.description: Maximum number of artifacts to create (only used in Poll Now)

actions.description: Get alert details

alert_id.description: ID of the alert to retrieve

actions.description: Search Alerts
actions.verbose: All query parameters are optional; at least one search term is required. All query parameters are in logical AND with each other. Defaults to last 30 days if no date range is provided.

username.description: Username of the actor listed on alert

start_date.description: Beginning of date range to search. Time (in UTC) may also be supplied but is not required

end_date.description: End of date range to search. Time (in UTC) may also be supplied but is not required

actions.description: Set the state of the alert

example_values: State of alert 2c425fc4-6875-46a3-95e0-2940dd83ae2b was updated to PENDING

actions.description: List all users
Create a new Code42 user account
actions.verbose: There is a short delay before you will be able to add the new user to the departing employee or high risk employee lists. For security reasons, we strongly recommend you to reset your password after first time login. Note: If the provided username already exists for a user, it will be updated in the database instead.

org_uid.description: Org UID to create user in

actions.description: Blocks a user from accessing their Code42 account
actions.verbose: Blocks a user from accessing their Code42 account (endpoint backup/security processes continue while blocked).

actions.description: Deactivates user's Code42 account
Reactivates a deactivated user's Code42 account
Unblocks a user, allowing access to their Code42 account
Get userrisk profile

username.description: The username associated with the user profile to get

actions.description: Add a user (custodian) to a legal hold matter

username.description: Username to be added to legal hold matter

matter_id.description: The identifier of the legal hold matter

example_values: This is testing purpose created matter
Username was added to legal hold matter 1936895883179241577

actions.description: Remove user (custodian) from a legal hold matter

username.description: Username of user to be removed from legal hold matter

matter_id.description: ID of the legal hold matter to remove the user from

example_values: Username was removed from legal hold matter 1936895883179241577

actions.description: Create a Code42 case
Update the details of a case
Change the status of a Code42 case to 'CLOSED'
List Code42 Cases
Associates a file event with a Code42 case
Searches Code42 for a backed-up file with a matching hash and downloads it

hash.description: The MD5 or SHA256 hash of the file to download

file_name.description: The name to give to the file after it is downloaded. If not supplied, the hash will be used

example_values: next.txt was successfully downloaded and attached to container 123

actions.description: Search for Code42 file events
actions.verbose: You can use wildcards (*,?) with most string-based fields. All query parameters are optional; at least one search term is required. All query parameters are in logical AND with each other.

start_date.description: Beginning of date range to search. Time (in UTC) may also be supplied but is not required

end_date.description: End of date range to search. Time (in UTC) may also be supplied but is not required

file_hash.description: MD5 or SHA256 hash of a file

username.description: Name of the user associated with the event

process_name.description: Process name involved in the exposure

url.description: Urls of all the browser tabs open during exposure

window_title.description: Names of all the open browser tabs or windows during exposure

untrusted_only.description: Return only events representing untrusted activity

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to fetch (default: 1000)

example_values: Free Email Addresses: Web based and secure

actions.description: Run an advanced query using JSON
actions.verbose: If page-related keys (pgNum, pgSize, pgToken) are available in the query, they will be ignored.

json_query.description: The raw JSON of the query to execute

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to fetch (default: 1000)

actions.description: List all the watchlists
Create a watchlist
Delete a watchlist
List all the users in a watchlist
Add a user to watchlist

usernames.description: Usernames of users to be added in watchlist (comma separated string)

add_user_using.description: Add user by watchlist_id or watchlist_type

actions.description: Remove a user from watchlist

usernames.description: Usernames to be removed from watchlist (comma separated string)

remove_user_using.description: Add user by watchlist_id or watchlist_type

actions.description: Remove a user from watchlist

username.description: Usernames to be removed from watchlist (comma separated string)

actions.description: Update user risk profile

start_date.description: Joining Date of the employee (in format YYYY-MM-DD)

end_date.description: Departure Date of the employee (in format YYYY-MM-DD)
